titleStmt.title: Gustav Marchet
born Baden, May 29, 1846; died Schlackenwerth, Bohemia, April 27, 1916

publicationStmt.publisher: Schenker Documents Online in association with the Centre for Computing in the Humanities

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines

div.p: Specialist in agriculture, Austrian Minister for Culture and Education 1906-08, from c. 1907 heavily involved in preparations for the Conservatory of the Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde to become a state institution, Honorary President of the Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde 1912-16 (also member of the commission of the Denkmäler der Tonkunst in Österreich 1911-16).

div.head: Correspondence with Schenker
div.p: Marchet appears as a cosignatory to one letter from the Gesellschaft der Musikfreunde to Schenker,OJ 11/22, [2] (June 21, 1912), and he is mentioned in letters to Hertzka: WSLB 124 (June 27, 1912) and WSLB 129 (August 6, 1912).

listBibl.bibl: Tittel, Ernst, Die Wiener Musikhochschule (Vienna: Lafite, 1967)
